titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Peter Davison Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 04:14

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract:
The Peter Davison Papers provide evidence of the career and personal life of author and editor Peter Davison. In addition to documenting Davison's professional and literary circles, the papers also provide insight into Davison's creative output, including his books of poetry (such as The Breaking of the Day
and Other Poems and Walking the Boundaries: Poems, 1957-1974 ) and his autobiography ( Half Remembered: A Personal History ). The papers are comprised of business and personal correspondence, writings, 1 audio compact disk, photographs, personal papers, and other papers by or relating to Peter Davison.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 16 (CD): Restricted Fragile Material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Peter Davison Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Peter Davison Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and in some instances minimal organization.

The finding aid for this collection is compiled from a preliminary list for the acquisition that was created at or around the time of receipt by the library. The preliminary list was migrated to comply with current archival descriptive standards and merged into a single file in 2007-2008. As part of the migration, modifications were made to the formatting of the list; however, the content of the list was neither modified nor verified.

As a rule, descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Peter Davison (1928-2004)
bioghist.p: Davison was a poet and literary editor for the Atlantic Monthly Press and Atlantic Monthly . He was born on June 27, 1928 in New York City to Edward and Natalie Weiner Davison. He began his editorial career at Harcourt, Brace in New York after graduating from Harvard University in 1949. In 1956 Davison joined the Atlantic Monthly Press where he worked in several capacities, including executive editor, director, and senior editor, until 1985. From 1985 to 1998 Davison was the poetry editor for Houghton Mifflin.

Davison maintained a writing career in tandem with his career as a literary editor. He published several books of poetry in addition to his autobiography Half Remembered: A Personal History (1973). His books of poetry include: The Breaking of the Day and Other Poems (1964), Walking the Boundaries: Poems, 1957-1974 (1974), and Breathing Room: New Poems (2000). Davison also edited One of the Dangerous Trades: Essays on the Work and Workings of Poetry (1991) and The Fading Smile: Poets in Boston, 1955-1960, from Robert Frost to Robert Lowell to Sylvia Plath (1994).

Davison married Jane Auchincloss Truslow, a writer, on March 7, 1959. They had two children: Edward Angus and Lesley Truslow. Following his first wife's death in 1981, Davison married the architect Joan Edelman Goody on August 11, 1984.
Davison died of pancreatic cancer on December 29, 2004 in Boston, Massachusetts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
The Peter Davison Papers provide evidence of the career and personal life of author and editor Peter Davison. In addition to documenting Davison's professional and literary circles, the papers also provide insight into Davison's creative output, including his books of poetry (such as The Breaking of the Day
and Other Poems and Walking the Boundaries: Poems, 1957-1974 ) and his autobiography ( Half Remembered: A Personal History ). The papers are comprised of business and personal correspondence, writings, 1 audio compact disk, photographs, personal papers, and other papers by or relating to Peter Davison.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: I. Correspondence, 1941-2002. Series II. Personal and Family Papers, 1938-1950s. Series III. Professional Papers, 1954-1995. Series IV. Writings, 1957-2003. Series V. Other Papers, 1970s-2005.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I is organized into two subseries: Business Correspondence and Personal Correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I contains Peter Davison's business and personal correspondence. Business correspondence is primarily comprised of Davison's editorial correspondence for the Atlantic Monthly Press. Family correspondence can also be found in Series II. Additional business correspondence, including Davison's work as a jury member for the Pulitzer Prize, is in Series III. Correspondence relating to specific writing projects is located in Series IV.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Not arranged in any particular order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II contains personal and family papers, including correspondence, early writing projects, journals, and school papers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Not arranged in any particular order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III contains professional papers in addition to some personal papers. Included is printed material about Davison and correspondence relating to Davison's work as a jury member for the Pulitzer Prize.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series IV is organized into three subseries: Poetry and Nonfiction; Readings, Speeches, and Robert Frost Materials; and Reviews, Correspondence, and Publishing Papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series IV is comprised of drafts, proofs, and galleys relating to Davison's publications. The series also includes drafts and research relating to Davison's public appearances (such as readings and speeches). Correspondence relating to writing projects can be found in this series.

scopecontent.p: Series V contains business papers, personal papers, financial records, printed material, and other materials.
